serverTime.description: The current time on the server.

certificates.description:
Returns a list of Certificates.

AccessScope:
  - Organization: Certificates linked to the organizations the caller is a member of
  - Subject: Own certificates

certificate.description:
Returns a single Certificate.

AccessScope:
  - Organization: Certificates linked to the organizations the caller is a member of
  - Subject: Own certificates

issuers.description:
Returns a list of Issuers.

AccessScopes:
  - Organization: All issuers
  - Subject: All issuers

issuer.description:
Returns a list of Issuers.

AccessScopes:
  - Organization: All issuers
  - Subject: All issuers

organizationLinks.description:
Returns a list of OrganizationLinks.

AccessScopes:
 - Organization: OrganizationLinks to the organizations the caller is a member of
 - Subject: OrganizationLinks to the caller

organizationLink.description:
Returns a single OrganizationLink.

AccessScopes:
 - Organization: OrganizationLinks to the organizations the caller is a member of
 - Subject: OrganizationLinks to the caller

signatureRequestInvites.description:
Returns a list of SignatureRequestInvites.

AccessScopes:
  - Organization: SignatureRequestInvites operated by the organizations the caller is a member of
  - Subject: SignatureRequestInvites where the subject is invited to sign

signatureRequestInvite.description:
Returns a single SignatureRequestInvite.

AccessScopes:
 - Organization: SignatureRequestInvites operated by the organizations the caller is a member of
 - Subject: SignatureRequestInvites where the subject is invited to sign

signatureRequests.description:
Returns a list of SignatureRequests.

AccessScopes:
 - Organization: SignatureRequests operated by the organizations the caller is a member of
 - Subject: SignatureRequests where the subject is invited to sign

signatureRequest.description:
Returns a single SignatureRequest.

AccessScopes:
 - Organization: SignatureRequests operated by the organizations the caller is a member of
 - Subject: SignatureRequests where the subject is invited to sign

subjects.description:
Returns a list of Subjects.

AccessScopes:
  - Organization: Subjects that are members of the organizations the caller is a member of
  - Subject: Own subject

subject.description:
Returns a single Subject.

AccessScopes:
  - Organization: Subjects that are members of the organizations the caller is a member of
  - Subject: Own subject

witnesses.description:
Returns a list of Witnesses.

AccessScopes:
  - Organization: All witnesses
  - Subject: All witnesses

witness.description:
Returns a single Witness.

AccessScopes:
  - Organization: All witnesses
  - Subject: All witnesses

createApiKey.description:
Creates a new api key for the organization. You can retrieve the generated API key later through the API.
Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

updateApiKey.description: Updates an existing API key. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

deleteApiKey.description: Deletes an existing API key. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

createOrganizationLink.description:
Creates a new link with the organization. This links enables the organization to view the certificate's subject information.
Only available if the caller bears an access token issued to the certificate of the linking subject.

deleteOrganizationLink.description: Deletes a link with an organization. Only available if the caller bears an access token issued to the certificate of the linking subject or for members of the organization.

createOrganizationMember.description: Creates a new member of the provided organization. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

deleteOrganizationMember.description: Removes an existing member of the provided organization. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

updateOrganization.description: Updates an existing organization. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

createSignatureRequestInvite.description: Creates a new signature request invite. Only available for members of the organization that created the signature request.

createSignatureRequest.description: Creates a new signature request. Only available for members or API keys of the organization that created the signature request.

updateSignatureRequest.description: Updates an existing signature request. Only available for members or API keys of the organization that created the signature request.

createWitness.description: Creates a new witness. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

updateWitness.description: Updates an existing witness. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

scheduleGroupedNOM151Certification.description:
Schedules a witness hash to be certified in a grouped merkle tree whose root hash is sent periodically to the NOM151 certification authority.
Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

NOM151Certification.description:
Requests an individual witness hash to be certified by the NOM151 certification authority.
Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

publishChallenge.description: Publishes a challenge signature. This allows an application to authenticate their users using Plumaa ID as a secure channel.

createdOrganizationLink.description: Subscribes to new links between the specified organization and subjects

createdOrganizationLinkByCertificate.description: Subscribes to new links between the organization and the certificate's subject

signedSignatureRequestInvite.description: Subscribes to signatures submitted to the specified signature request invite

challenge.description:
Creates a one-time-password challenge for the user to sign.
The signature is used to authenticate the user, which then publishes it to the server using the publishChallenge endpoint.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

operation.description: Description of the operation performed within the api call.

status.description: The status code returned by the operation.

message.description: The message returned by the operation if errored.

apiKey.description: The ApiKey that made the call.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

ApiCall.description: An ApiCall is a record of an API call made by an ApiKey.

message.description: Matches a similar string in the message field.

field.description: The field to sort results by.

enabled.description: Whether the API key is enabled or not. If disabled, it will not be possible to make calls through the API with this key.

name.description: The name of the API key. It is used to identify the key in the UI.

secret.description: The secret of the API key. It is used to authenticate the key when making calls through the API.

organization.description: The organization that owns the API key.

field.description: The field to sort results by.

order.description: The order to sort results by.

organization.description: The organization that owns the API key.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

serialNumber.description:
The certificate's serial number, as a hexadecimal string. This is a unique
identifier for the certificate, and is assigned by the issuer.

issuer.description:
The certificate's issuer. This is the entity that issued the certificate, and
is a Certificate Authority certified by Banxico.

notBefore.description: The earliest date at which the certificate is valid.

notAfter.description: The latest date at which the certificate is valid.

subject.description:
The certificate's subject. This is the entity that the certificate is
attesting to, and is typically a person or organization ("persona física o
moral" in spanish).

publicKey.description:
The certificate's public key. This is the public key that identifies messages
signed by its corresponding private key.

version.description: The version of the X.509 standard that the certificate conforms to.

hash.description: SHA256 message digest of the issuer's certificate.

certificatePem.description: AWS S3 URI path to the certificate's PEM data.

revoked.description: Whether the certificate has been revoked by the issuer.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

Certificate.description:
A certificate is a digitally signed statement from one entity (the issuer) that
another entity (the subject) has a given identity. The issuer is a
Certificate Authority certified by Banxico, and the subject is typically a
person or organization ("persona física o moral" in Spanish).

exponent.description: The public key's modulus, as a hexadecimal string.

modulus.description: The public key's exponent, as a hexadecimal string.

PublicKey.description: An RSA public key, as defined in RFC 3447.

field.description: The field to sort results by.

ResultsInfo.description: Pagination info about the results of a query.

mark.description: The bucket mark for the creation timepoint, defined by granularity.

count.description: Amount of signature requests created in the bucket.

An Issuer is a Certificate Authority certified by Banxico to
issue digital signature certificates to Mexican citizens.

OrganizationLink.description:
An Organization Link is a connection between an Organization and a Subject.
It allows the Organization to send signing requests to the Subject.

OrganizationMember.description:
OrganizationMember is a join table between Organization and Subject.
It is used to track which users are members of which organizations.

The name of the Organization. This is the name that will be displayed to
users when interacting with signature requests from this organization.

logo.description:
The logo of the Organization. This is the logo that will be displayed to
users when interacting with signature requests from this organization.

emailAddress.description: Email address of the organization. Updates and notifications will be sent to this address, as well as the billing information.

Organization.description:
An Organization represents an tenant in the Plumaa infrastructure. All paid
resources are associated with an Organization. Organizations can have multiple
certificate members.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

API.description: API is enabled for the organization.

groupedNOM151.description: The amount of grouped NOM151 certificates available to the organization.

nom151.description: The amount of NOM151 certificates available to the organization.

Quota.description: Quota defines the resource limits for an organization.

Policies.description: Policies define the behavior of the resources in the organization.

conservation.description: Type of conservation strategy to use by default at signature request readiness (ie. when draft is false).

SignatureRequestPolicies.description: SignatureRequestPolicies defines the policies for signatureRequests.

name.description: Matches a similar string in the name field.

field.description: The field to sort results by.

name.description:
The name of the Organization. This is the name that will be displayed to
users when interacting with signature requests from this organization.

logo.description:
The logo of the Organization. This is the logo that will be displayed to
users when interacting with signature requests from this organization.

It must be a path under Plumaa's S3 assets.

emailAddress.description: Email address of the organization. Updates and notifications will be sent to this address, as well as the billing information.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

name.description:
The name of the Organization. This is the name that will be displayed to
users when interacting with signature requests from this organization.

emailAddress.description: Email address of the organization. Updates and notifications will be sent to this address, as well as the billing information.

logo.description:
The logo of the Organization. This is the logo that will be displayed to
users when interacting with signature requests from this organization.

It must be a path under Plumaa's S3 assets.

conservation.description: Type of conservation strategy to use by default at signature request readiness (ie. when draft is false).

certificateId.description: Certificate ID of the certificate that is being logged in.

url.description: The presigned URL to upload a file to.

key.description: Key of the object. This is the key that the object will have in the bucket.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

signatureRequest.description: The signature request this invite is linked to.

subject.description: The subject this invite is linked to.

certificate.description: The certificate this invite was signed with.

signature.description: The signature from the certificate as a hexadecimal string.

ocspResponse.description:
The OCSP response from checking the certificate against the CA.
ASN1 encoded as a hexadecimal string.

witness.description: Witness that attest the signature using a merkle proof

status.description: The status of the signature request invite.

rejectedAt.description: Date at which the signature request invite was rejected. Only present if rejected.

signedAt.description: Date at which the signature request invite was signed. Only present if signed.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

SignatureRequestInvite.description:
A signature request invite is an invite to sign a signature request.
It links a signature request to a subject and it stores its corresponding
signature and the link to the certificate that the signature belongs to.

field.description: The field to sort results by.

signatureRequest.description: The signature request this invite is linked to.

subject.description: The subject this invite is linked to.

anonymousKey.description: A shared key that allows to self invite if provided.

CreateSignatureRequestInviteInput.description: Input to create a signature request invite.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

draft.description:
Whether the document is a draft or not.
A draft signature request won't allow invites to sign and will skip processing notifications.

finalized.description:
Whether the document is finalized or not.
A finalized request won't allow new invites and won't process any new notifications.

name.description: Custom name for the signature request.

content.description: The content data to be signed.

anonymousKey.description: Key for sharing the sharing the signature request. Can be used to access the signature request without authentication.

witness.description: Witness that attest the content using a merkle proof

signed.description: Amount of invites that have signed the content.

pending.description: Amount of invites that have not signed the content.

rejected.description: Amount of invites that have rejected the content.

rejectedAt.description: Date when the signature request was rejected. Only present if rejected.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

SignatureRequest.description: A signature request is an entity that represents a piece of data that needs to be signed by a user.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

RawContent.description: Raw content is a string that can be signed.

longitude.description: Longitude coordinates where the IOU is created.

json.description: An AWS S3 URL to the JSON.

JSONContent.description: JSON content is a JSON object that can be signed.

pdf.description: An AWS S3 URL to the PDF.

JSONContentInput.description: Content for a JSONContent signature request.

pdf.description: An AWS S3 Key to the PDF.

PDFContentInput.description: Content for a PDFContent signature request.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

serialNumber.description: CURP of the subject. It is a unique identifier for people in Mexico.

RFC.description: RFC of the subject. It is a unique identifier for persons and organizations in Mexico.

termsInvite.description: Invite for the subject to sign Plumaa own terms and conditions.

pushNotificationToken.description: The push notification token associated with the certificate. Used for sending notifications to the user.

EVMAddress.description:
EVM address of the subject.

Each account is a smart account that includes a single signer contract deterministically created from a factory deployed through [xdeployer](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/xdeployer)
so that every signer contract has the same address in all EVM networks. This signer contract is an implementation of a custom ERC-1271 interface that allows
the RSA key to sign on-chain. Signers can be deployed trustlessly by anyone since they're controlled by the account owner.

The smart account is created from the [Safe{Wallet}](https://github.com/safe-global/safe-deployments/blob/main/src/assets/v1.4.1) factory and includes a setup call to the RSA signer factory,
deploying the signer contract who'll own the account. The account factory is already deployed on all networks with the same address so that the account can be created deterministically
in all EVM networks too

This setup allows the following properties:

* The signer contract factory can create the same signer contract in all EVM chains for the same RSA key
* The account can be created deterministically in all EVM chains because it depends on the signer contract address and the RSA public key

In this way, the EVM address is completely abstracted from the EVM network, so we just need to keep a single address.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

Subject.description:
A subject is a person or an organization ("persona física o moral" in Spanish)
identified by a certificate.

commonName.description: Matches a similar string in the commonName field.

emailAddress.description: Matches a similar string in the emailAddress field.

RFC.description: RFC of the subject. It is a unique identifier for persons and organizations in Mexico.

field.description: The field to sort results by.

pushNotificationToken.description: Token to send push notifications to the user.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

hash.description: Hash of the document to witness.

algorithm.description: The algorithm used for hashing the document.

initialOwner.description:
Subject designed as the first in the endorsement chain. Only a member of the operating organization can set this field.
Once set, our on-chain relayer will submit a proof of endorsement to the Witness contract so that the corresponding
token can be minted by the user later on the application.

claiming.description:
Information required to claim a document in the Endorser contract. It is only present if the witness is processed and restricted
to the initial owner.

claimed.description: If the witness has been claimed by the initial owner.

signatureRequest.description:
Signature Request the witness is associated with.
May not be present if the witness was via the API.

timestampedAt.description: Earliest date when the hash was witnessed by any strategy. Unspecified if the witness is not processed.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

Witness.description:
A witness is an entity representing a proof that a document existed at the time.
It is used to comply with the law requirement of data conservation.

provider.description: The provider that issued the timestamp.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

txHash.description:
The transaction hash. Any transaction that includes an operation with this hash is valid.
It could be either a transaction to another service (eg. The Witness contract), but it may be upgraded
in the future.

items.description: A field whose value is a hexadecimal: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal.

merkleProof.description: The proof that the root existed at the time of the transaction.

merkleRoot.description:
Merkle root included in the transaction. It should be the same as the one
computed from the merkle proof and the leaf hash.

nom151Provider.description: The NOM 151 provider that issued the timestamp for the merkle root.

algorithm.description:
Algorithm for hashing the internal nodes. The document hash is also re hashed using this algorithm to avoid
second pre-image attacks. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merkle_tree#Second_preimage_attack

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

timestamp.description: The timestamp issued by the provider.

leafIndex.description: The index of the leaf to be verified in the tree.

items.description: A field whose value is a hexadecimal: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal.

leftHashes.description: The left range of the proof.

items.description: A field whose value is a hexadecimal: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal.

rightHashes.description: The right range of the proof.

targetRootHash.description: The root of the tree the proof is being verified against.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

id.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

authorizer.description:
The address that signed the authorization to claim the document.
Needs to have privileges within Plumaa ID's AccessManager contract.

signature.description:
Authorization signature. It's an EIP-712 signature of the hash of the claim and the initial claiming address.
* Domain Separator: `EIP712Domain(string name,string version,uint256 chainId,address verifyingContract)`
* EIP-712 Type: `MintRequest(bytes32 leaf,address to)`

claimer.description: Address of the initial claiming subject.

network.description: The chain ID where the claim is authorized.

createdAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

updatedAt.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

If provided, it will apply an $exists filter.
See https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/exists/#-exists

eq.description:
If provided, it will apply an $eq filter.
See https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/eq/#op._S_eq

ne.description:
If provided, it will apply a $ne filter.
See https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/ne/#op._S_ne

in.description:
If provided, it will apply an $in filter.
See https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/in/#op._S_in

nin.description:
If provided, it will apply a $nin filter.
See https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/nin/#op._S_nin

schema.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

post.description: Creates a new witness. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

put.description: Updates an existing witness. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

post.description:
Creates a new api key for the organization. You can retrieve the generated API key later through the API.
Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

put.description: Updates an existing API key. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

delete.description: Deletes an existing API key. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

post.description:
Creates a new link with the organization. This links enables the organization to view the certificate's subject information.
Only available if the caller bears an access token issued to the certificate of the linking subject.

delete.description: Deletes a link with an organization. Only available if the caller bears an access token issued to the certificate of the linking subject or for members of the organization.

post.description: Creates a new member of the provided organization. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

delete.description: Removes an existing member of the provided organization. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

put.description: Updates an existing organization. Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

post.description: Creates a new signature request invite. Only available for members of the organization that created the signature request.
Creates a new signature request. Only available for members or API keys of the organization that created the signature request.

put.description: Updates an existing signature request. Only available for members or API keys of the organization that created the signature request.

post.description:
Schedules a witness hash to be certified in a grouped merkle tree whose root hash is sent periodically to the NOM151 certification authority.
Only available for members or API keys of the organization.

Requests an individual witness hash to be certified by the NOM151 certification authority.
Only available for members or API keys of the organization.
Publishes a challenge signature. This allows an application to authenticate their users using Plumaa ID as a secure channel.
